channel.title: hiking on Haojin's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in hiking on Haojin's Blog

item.title: Antelope Canyon & Horseshoe Bend
item.description: 今天没有National Park，却也是独一无二的美景。

item.title: Arches National Park
item.description: 离我们的驻地Moab小镇10分钟车程，便是以各种自然拱门而闻名的Arches National Park。

item.title: Canyonlands National Park
item.description: 开车的时候明显能感觉到，越北上，气温反而越高，路边的积雪已几乎没了踪影。

item.title: Bryce Canyon National Park
item.description: Zion之后，我们马不停蹄地赶往下一个人间绝美之境。

item.title: My sophomore Fall
item.description: It has been a bittersweet semester with so many things happening out of control in an unexpected way.

item.title: Shenandoah National Park
item.description: It was my first ever self-planed hiking roadtrip which turned out to be amazing ever since the very beginning.

item.title: Last Spring Festival with Family
item.description:
The year of OX, the last Spring Festival I could spend time with family members together. In my childhood memory, the New Year was full of happiness, mostly sounds of firecrackers… However, as growing up I find less and less interest and meaningful this traditional festival is. It soon became a period of blank. Nothing much I could do. Yet, this year, is completely different for me.

My mom was the first person reminded me of the importance of this year. She planned a lot of places to go where we never had available time to visit together.

item.title: Physical Exercises
item.description:
On August 28th, I went to a military training base in rural area of my city with my fellow students. Originally, I thought it would be a tough time based on all my past formidable experience with such training. However, I didn’t take it anymore during my time in both middle and high school. I took a trip and had computer science classes instead. A fun fact is that I became the whitest among my class after they coming back from training.

Apart from worry, excitement also haunted around me because it’s been a long time to have a training. The result turned out it didn’t let me down and I really learned a lot from this fantastic experience.

Being a team leader

Trying my best to be the team leader is always my style, especially participating in a short-time camp. I frimly deem it’s a great opportunity to promote and improve myself. Then I became the leader of group 6 without any hesitate. I deeply know that I am lack of leadership and most important, the decisive personality. This time I failed again on improving that. Everytime I become a leader in a program, unfortunately, I never felt improvement in this field.

Besides that, I believe I did great a great job. Organizing the team, encourging everyone doing high-altitude program and cimmitting myself to everything I can.
